column4: Does anyone know if ubuntu's gcc sets -Werror-implicit-function-declaration someplace?
I've been trying to install the rt2870 modules, and they don't build
There is a warning about implicit function declarations, which then becomes an error.
I've tried to find the offending lines and remove them, but this hasn't worked./
I'm assuming that if this option was meant to be set, then someone at ralink would have seen the issue.
Which makes me think the issue is with something in ubuntu's setup
there are a lot of .o.cmd files, but I think these are generated by the makefile and not used by the makefile
this is the rt2870sta kernel module
as far as I can tell, i have it.
do you have any specific information about where to get the firmware, and what to do with it when I get it?
: unplug the adaptor and post your "dmesg" to paste bin
i got the rt2860 firmware and the rt2870 firmware and placed both .bin files in /lib/firmware
agian, no internet access.  the dmesg is pretty short though
